Product.title: Product
Product.description: Represents a product in the Atelier Luxe catalog.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Product entity.

description.description: A detailed description of the product.

imageUrl.description: URL of the product's main image.

category.description: The category the product belongs to (e.g., Men's Clothing, Women's Clothing).

additionalImageUrls.description: URLs of additional images for the product.

Review.title: Review
Review.description: Represents a review for a product.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Review entity.

userName.description: The name of the user who left the review.

rating.description: The rating given in the review (e.g., 1 to 5).

createdAt.description: The date the review was submitted.

Order.title: Order
Order.description: Represents an order placed by a user. Orders are stored in a top-level 'orders' collection.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Order entity, generated by Firestore.

userId.description: The ID of the user who placed the order. (Relationship: UserProfile 1:N Order)

shippingInfo.description: The shipping details provided by the user.

items.description: The items included in the order.

totalAmount.description: The total amount of the order.

orderDate.description: The date the order was placed (server timestamp).

paymentStatus.description: The status of the payment (e.g., pending, processing, completed, rejected).

receiptImageUrl.description: A Base64-encoded Data URI of the user's payment receipt image. Max size 1MB.

id.description: Unique identifier for the UserProfile entity, same as the Firebase Auth UID.

isAdmin.description: Indicates if the user has administrative privileges.

photoURL.description: URL of the user's profile picture, stored as a Base64 Data URI.

/products/{productId}.description: Stores product information. Accessible to all users for reading.

/products/{productId}/reviews/{reviewId}.description: Stores reviews for each product. Anyone can read reviews, but only authenticated users can create them.

/userProfiles/{userId}.description: Stores user profile information. Only the authenticated user can read/write their own profile. Admins have special access.

/orders/{orderId}.description: Stores all order information. Any authenticated user can create their own order. Admins can read all orders.
